meanings.definition: To abandon one's religious or political beliefs.
meanings.sent1: She was apostatizing from her old religion to explore new beliefs.
meanings.sent2: The politician was caught apostatizing from his party's principles.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to be apostatizing from its usual sleeping spot to find a new favorite.
meanings.sent4: The leaves were apostatizing from the tree, falling one by one in the autumn breeze.
meanings.sent5: The student was apostatizing from their study routine, trying a new method for better grades.

meanings.definition: The act of renouncing a belief or allegiance.
meanings.sent1: His apostatizing from the group shocked everyone at the meeting.
meanings.sent2: The apostatizing of the soldier from his country's flag was seen as an act of betrayal.
meanings.sent3: The sudden apostatizing of the dog from its favorite toy left the owner puzzled.
meanings.sent4: The apostatizing of the waves from the shore created a sense of freedom in the vast ocean.
meanings.sent5: The apostatizing of the employee from the company's values led to his resignation.

meanings.definition: A person who has abandoned their beliefs or principles.
meanings.sent1: She was considered an apostatizing after leaving the organization.
meanings.sent2: The apostatizing was once a loyal follower of the cause.
meanings.sent3: The little girl pretended to be an apostatizing from eating vegetables, much to her parents' amusement.
meanings.sent4: The apostatizing stood out in the crowd, no longer conforming to the group's norms.
meanings.sent5: The apostatizing's actions spoke louder than words, showing a complete shift in beliefs.
